result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jonathan R Hintz was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: -Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

If Revoked: 
-Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 
-Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

-Sentence credit of 3 days credit if revoked.
-Court does not object to transfer to Jefferson County if accepted.

miscConds.notes: -Fine to be paid as a condition of probation. Cash bail applied to fine. Fine paid in full.

-Fine to be paid as a condition of probation. Cash bail applied to costs. Costs paid in full. 
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
-Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Oconomowoc Police Department.

-Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. 
-No Use or Possession of CBD Products. 
-Installation of the Ignition Interlock Device. 
-Attend at a Victim Impact Panel in Waukesha County within 6 months. 
-Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license; comply with all driver's licensing restrictions.

-If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
-Huber with standard release conditions. 
-Sentence credit of 3 days granted.

-Court has no objection to transfer to Jefferson County if accepted. Court has no objection to electronic monitoring if Sheriff deems appropriate.
